content.text: Let's learn how to make plans with a friend in Italian. We will start by suggesting an activity for the weekend.

data.meaning: Do you have plans for the weekend?

content.text: To suggest 'Let's go to...', you can use the phrase 'Andiamo a...?'.

data.tip: The accent on the final 'à' means you should put the stress on that syllable.

content.title: Proposing a Weekend Plan
content.setting: You are talking to your friend, Marco, about the upcoming weekend.

conversation_flow.title: Ask your friend if they have plans for the weekend
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ciao! Che bello, è quasi weekend!

conversation_flow.title: Suggest going to another city for a day trip
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ciao! No, non ho piani. Hai qualche idea?

extract_info.city_name: Extract the name of the city the user suggests

conversation_flow.title: Mention an activity you can do there
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Andare a {city_name}? Ottima idea! E cosa possiamo fare lì?

content.text: To talk about modes of transport, use the preposition 'con', which means 'with'. For example, 'con il treno' (by train).
When suggesting a meeting time, use 'Vediamoci' (Let's meet) followed by 'alle' (at) and the time.

data.meaning: What do you think? / What do you say?

content.title: Arranging the Details
content.setting: Marco likes your idea. Now you need to sort out the logistics.

conversation_flow.title: Suggest going by train
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Un museo è una bella idea. Allora, come andiamo a {city_name}?

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a time to meet on Saturday morning
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Sì, il treno è comodo. Quando ci vediamo sabato?

extract_info.meeting_time: Extract the time the user suggests

conversation_flow.title: Ask what they think of the plan
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Sabato mattina alle {meeting_time} va bene per me

content.text: A great way to agree to a plan is to say 'D'accordo', which means 'Agreed' or 'Alright'.
For some common places like the station, Italians often use 'in' instead of 'a'. For example, 'in stazione'.

data.tip: The 'zio' combination sounds like 'tsioh', with a 'ts' sound like in 'pizza'.

content.title: Finalizing the Trip
content.setting: You and Marco are about to finalize your weekend plans.

conversation_flow.title: Agree on the final destination and activity
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Penso che sia un piano fantastico!

conversation_flow.title: Confirm the meeting time and place
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Sì, perfetto. Allora ci vediamo sabato. Dove?

conversation_flow.title: Express excitement for the trip
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ok, in stazione alle {meeting_time}. Perfetto! A sabato!
